title: Ofgem ramps up RIIO-2 funding to £40bn in final determination
lead: ​Ofgem has upped the funding available to network companies under the next RIIO-T2 price control period from 2021-2026.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Local electricity pricing could save consumers £2.1bn annually
lead: ​Introducing local electricity pricing could reduce electricity system costs by as much as £2.1 billion a year from 2030 onwards, according to a new report.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: EDF furthers battery storage optimisation portfolio with SWGT deal
lead: ​Battery storage asset manager SWGT has signed a long-term optimisation agreement with EDF for its 30MW utility-scale battery.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Power prices spike to £720/MWh as low winds continue to stretch grid
lead: ​It has been a tumultuous weekend for energy prices in the UK, with an unprecedented day-ahead clearing price for a Sunday of £350/MWh.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ScottishPower takes on collapsed supplier Yorkshire Energy’s customers
lead: ​ScottishPower has taken on collapsed Yorkshire Energy’s 74,000 domestic customers as well as a small number of non-domestic customers.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Roisin Quinn steps down as National Grid ESO shakes up top team
lead: ​Roisin Quinn has stepped down as head of national control to pursue a new role in the National Grid Group, with Isabelle Haigh to takeover from spring 2021.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Uniper moves ahead in National Grid ESO inertia contract with Siemens deal
lead: ​Uniper has appointed Siemens Energy to deliver grid stabilisation as part of its inertia contract with National Grid ESO.
author: Alice Grundy

title: GRIDSERVE celebrates 'major milestone' as UK’s first Electric Forecourt opens for business
lead: GRIDSERVE’s Electric Forecourt near Braintree in Essex has officially opened for business.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: BM prices skyrocket to £1,000/MWh as cold weather and low wind bites
lead: ​Prices in the Balancing Mechanism hit £1,000/MWh last night (03 December) with two CCGT offers accepted at the price.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Nottinghamshire to pilot EV charging point for electric buses
lead: ​Nottinghamshire County Council has partnered with energy storage start-up Cheesecake Energy Ltd (CEL) to pilot EV charging points for a new fleet of electric buses.
author: Edith Hancock

title: Johnson targets ‘further and faster’ climate action with 68% emissions reduction
lead: Prime Minister Boris Johnson has committed to cutting the UK’s emissions by at least 68% by 2030.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Centrica Business Solutions to optimise Eelpower’s 10MW battery
lead: ​Centrica Business Solutions is to optimise Eelpower’s 10MW Leverton storage project.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Smart meter installations hold steady despite lockdown
lead: Energy companies' smart meter installations have "rebounded" since the UK's first coronavirus lockdown despite restrictions waxing and waning across the country, new figures show.
author: Edith Hancock

title: Shell backs GreenCom’s €12 million equity funding bid for global expansion
lead: O&G giant Shell has backed residential renewables platform GreenCom Network’s €12 million (£11 million) funding round through its investment arm, Shell Ventures.
author: Edith Hancock

title: BP brings Chargemaster and Polar together under new BP Pulse umbrella
lead: ​BP has launched BP Pulse, the new name for both BP Chargemaster and the Polar network.
author: Alice Grundy

title: National Grid ESO issues CM notice as low generation eats into its safety buffer
lead: ​National Grid ESO has issued a Capacity Market (CM) notice for this afternoon, with the margin set to fall below the set threshold.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Instavolt to rollout 450 chargers in new KFC partnership
lead: ​Instavolt has signed a second partnership with a UK fast food retailer, unveiling plans to install chargers at KFC UK & Ireland’s sites.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Yorkshire Energy becomes latest supplier to close as market remains challenging for small players
lead: ​Yorkshire Energy has ceased to trade, becoming the latest small supplier casualty of 2020.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: CMA launches EV charging sector study to tackle range anxiety and promote competition
lead: ​The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has launched a study into to the electric vehicle (EV) charging sector to ensure the fast-growing area works for UK drivers.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: CCC: UK should aim for 68% carbon emissions reduction for 2030 NDC
lead: ​A UK reduction in territorial emissions of at least 68% as part of its nationally determined contribution (NDC) has been recommended by the Committee on Climate Change (CCC).
author: Alice Grundy
